ext_descriptions.ext_description: An applied_promissory_usage_in_product_model_assignment is a type of that specifies a set of . One item shall be a and the other item shall be a .

ext_description.p: the items specifies a role of the for the applied_promissory_usage_in_product_model_assignment.

A promissory_usage_in_product_model is a type of that participates in an assignment to indicate that a is to be associated with a product_model. The promissory_usage_in_product_model string attributes may be populated with 'undefined' to indicate there is no requirement associated with these attributes.
ext_description.note: The group entity is provided for structural consistency with other parts of this standard.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The promissory_usage_in_product_model shall be referenced by an .

ext_description.p: A supplied_part_relationship is a type of .A supplied_part_relationship relates the identifications of two products and specifies that one is the identification used by the internal design organization and the other is the identification used by a supplier.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The supplied_part_relationship shall have a in which the source is specified.
The supplied_part_relationship shall not be the definition of a .

ext_description.p: The approval_requires_approval_date_time rule assures that each instance of approval has an associated date or time.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of approval, there shall be exactly one instance of .

ext_description.p: The approval_requires_approval_person_organization rule assures that for each instance of approval there is an organization or person that is responsible for that approval.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of approval, there shall be one or more instances of .

ext_description.p: The approval_role_constraint rule assures that each has a role that is 'authorizer'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of , the role shall be 'authorizer'.

ext_description.p: The approvals_are_assigned rule assures that each approval is referenced by at least one as .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of approval, there shall be one or more instances of .

ext_description.p: The certification_requires_date_or_date_and_time rule assures that each certification has an associated or an .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of certification, exactly one instance of or exactly one instance of shall contain the instance of certification in its set of items.

ext_description.p: The certification_unique_constraint rule constrains the certification.name population members to satisfy the uniqueness requirement of the ARM application object Certification.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The name shall be unique within a population of certification.

ext_description.p: The configuration_item_requires_person_organization rule assures that each has an or an .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of , there shall be exactly one instance of that contains the instance of in its set of items.
The contract_unique_constraint rule constrains the contract.name population members to satisfy the uniqueness requirement of the ARM application object Contract.
The name shall be unique within a population of contract.

ext_description.p: The date_and_time_require_minute_and_second rule constrains to include a minute and second component.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A shall have a ..
A shall have a ..

ext_description.p: The date_constraint rule specifies that all instances of date shall have a that has 4 digits.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of date, the shall be greater than or equal to 1856.

ext_description.p: The dependent_instantiable_action_directive rule specifies that all instances of are dependent on the usage to define another entity.

ext_description.p: The directed_action_requires_approval rule assure that each instance of has an associated .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of , there shall be exactly one instance of that contains the instance of in its set of items.

ext_description.p: The directed_action_requires_date_or_date_and_time rule assures that each instance of has an associated or an .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of , there shall be exactly one instance of whose role.name is 'start date' or exactly one instance of whose role.name is 'start date' that contains the instance of in its set of items.

ext_description.p: The ee_product_configuration_unique_constraint rule constrains the population members, that fill the role of ARM , so that the combination of ARM and ARM satisfying_product attributes shall be unique within the population.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Every instance of must have a unique combination of id attribute and entity related to the by a entity.

ext_description.p: The ee_product_constraint rule constrains the usage of a product.
ext_description.note: Since there is no standard interpretation of category for Ee_product, there is no population constraint on in this rule.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A product shall be an items in (an .role.name = 'design owner') (a .role.name = 'design owner').
A product shall be the of at least one .

ext_description.p: The ee_product_definition_constraint rule constrains the use of a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A shall be the item of one with a date and time role name = 'creation date'.
A shall be the item of at least one ( with an organization role name = 'creator') ( with a person and organization role name = 'creator').
A shall be the item of one .
A shall be the item of one .

ext_description.p: The ee_product_model_unique_constraint rule constrains the .id population members to satisfy the uniqueness requirement of the ARM application object Ee_product_model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The id shall be unique within a population of .

The ee_product_unique_constraint rule constrains the product population members, that fill the role of ARM , so that the combination of ARM and ARM design_owner attributes shall be unique within the population.

Every instance of product must have a unique combination of id attribute and either organization or entity assigned to the product by either an 's or an applied_person_andorganization_assignment's items attribute.

ext_description.p: The ee_product_version_supersedence_constraint rule constrains the usage of a when it is a product version supersedence.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: IF .name = 'product version supersedence' THEN the relating version and the related version shall be for the same product.

ext_description.p: The next_higher_assembly_relationship_constraint rule constrains the use of a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Each shall be the definition of not more than one which is the definition of not more than two each of whose used_representation is a component_location which shall have either a 2 or 3d context, but there shall be no more than one of each context.

ext_description.p: The organization_unique_constraint rule constrains the organization.id population members to satisfy the uniqueness requirement of the ARM application object Organization.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The id shall be unique within a population of organization.

ext_description.p: The planned_effectivity_constraint rule constrains the usage of a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Each shall have a usage that is an with a name = 'assembly composition'.
Each shall be an items in an .

ext_description.p: The planned_effectivity_unique_constraint rule constrains the population members, that fill the role of ARM planned_effectivity, to be have unique ARM effective_assembly entities on each ARM configuration entity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Every instance of that has a common configuration.configuration attribute must have a unique usage attribute value.

ext_description.p: The product_concept_requires_configuration_item assures that each instance of shall have a which is a item_concept.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of , there shall be at least one instance of that contains the instance of as the value of its item_concept attribute.

The product_definition_formation_requires_person_organization rule assures that each instance of that implements the Application Objec Ee_product_version shall have either an applied_person_and_organization or an in the role of 'creator'.

For each that is not an implementation of Ee_product_version referenced by an implementation of , exactly one instance of whose role.name is 'creator' or exactly one instance of whose role.name is 'creator' shall contain the instance of in its set of items.

ext_description.p: The product_requires_person_organization rule requires all product entities to be the items of exactly one or .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of product, there shall be exactly one instance of or exactly one instance of that contains the instance of product in its set of items.

ext_description.p: The product_requires_product_definition_formation rule requires all product entities to be the of at least one .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each product there shall be at least one instance of that contains the instance of product in its set of .

ext_description.p: The restrict_action_request_status rule restricts the status value of all entities to be either:

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of the entity, the status attribute shall have a value of "proposed", "in work", "issued", or "hold".

ext_description.p: The restrict_approval_status rule restricts the name value of all entities to be either:

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of approval, the value of the name attribute shall be either "approved", "not yet approved", "disapproved" or "withdrawn".

ext_description.p: The restrict_date_role rule restricts the name value of all entities to be either:

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of , the name attribute shall have the value of "creation date", "request date", "release date", "start date", "contract date", "certification date", "sign off date", "classification date", or "declassification date".

ext_description.p: The security_classification_constraint rule constrains the usage of a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Each shall be an items of either an whose role name = 'classification date' or an whose role name = 'classification date'.
Each shall be an items of an whose role name = 'classification officer'.
Each shall be an items of an .

ext_description.p: The subtype_exclusive_action_request_assignment rule requires all entities to be at most one of change_request or start_request.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An instance of shall be at most one of type change_request, or start_request.

ext_description.p: The subtype_exclusive_product_definition_relationship rule requires all entities be at most one of the following:

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An instance of shall be at most one of type , , or .

ext_description.p: The subtype_exclusive_property_definition_representation rule requires all entities to be at most one of or .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An instance of shall be at most one of type or .

ext_description.p: The subtype_mandatory_address rule requires all address entities to be either or .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Each instance of address shall be of type or .

ext_description.p: The subtype_mandatory_date rule requires all date entities to be .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Each instance of date shall be of type .

ext_description.p: The subtype_mandatory_product_definition_usage rule requires all entities to be either or .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Each instance of shall be of type or .

ext_description.p: The supplied_product_version_unique_constraint rule constrains the population members, that fill the role of ARM , to have unique supplier_part_numbers on each supplier.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Every instance of that is referenced by a that is referenced in a that share a common supplier must have a unique . attribute value.

ext_description.p: The versioned_action_request_requires_approval rule specifies that each instance of shall have exactly one approval. An approval for a is defined by the entity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of there shall be exactly one instance of that contains the instance of in its set of items.

ext_description.p: The versioned_action_request_requires_date_or_date_and_time rule specifies that each instance of shall have exactly one date or for it. A date for a is defined by the entity and a is defined by the entity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of , exactly one instance of or exactly one instance of shall contain the instance of in its set of items.

ext_description.p: The versioned_action_request_requires_person_organization rule specifies that each instance of shall have one or more organizations or person_and_organizations assigned to it. An organization for a is defined by the entity and a is defined by the entity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of , there shall be at least one instance of or at least one instance of that contains the instance of in its set of items.

ext_description.p: A versioned_action_request_requires_status rule specifies that each instance of shall have exactly one status. The status of a is defined by the entity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: For each instance of there shall be exactly one instance of that contains an attribute value equal to that instance of .

ext_description.p: The work_request_unique_constraint rule constrains the population members, that fill the role of ARM , to be uniquely identifiable.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Every instance of that is an of either a change_request or a start_request must have a unique id attribute value.
A promissory_usage_in_product_model_assigned_item type specifies those items to which a promissory_usage_in_product_model_assignment may be made.
